summary: On Repeat Today: Light of the Seven, Game of Thrones OST -- Ramin Djawadi
title: On Repeat Today: Light of the Seven, Game of Thrones OST -- Ramin Djawadi
body:
🎵 On Repeat Today: Light of the Seven, Game of Thrones OST – Ramin Djawadi 🎵

I guess I’m a fan of Ramin Djawadi 🙂

I posted about his work with the Westworld soundtrack a few weeks ago, and discovered today that he also works on the soundtracks for Game of Thrones. I’m really enjoying this specific song today:

https://jeremy.hu/wp-content/uploads/Game-of-Thrones-Season-6-OST-Light-of-the-Seven-EP-10-Trial-scene.mp3

I wish I would have found out about this months ago.…

View On WordPress

tags: No new 'Game of Thrones' book this year - CNN
summary: No new ‘Game of Thrones’ book this year
title: No new ‘Game of Thrones’ book this year
body:
(CNN)Sorry “Game of Thrones” fans, but winter is not coming this year.

Author George R.R. Martin has announced his long-awaited book “The Winds of Winter” will not be released in 2018.
Martin posted the update Wednesday on his official blog.
    “No, winter is not coming … not in 2018, at least.” he wrote. “You’re going to have to keep waiting for THE WINDS OF WINTER.”
    ‘Game of Thrones” author releases new chapter
    The novel “A Game of Thrones” was published in 1996. It’s the first in the fantasy series titled “A Song of Ice and Fire.”
    The books spurred a successful HBO TV adaptation that debuted in 2011.
    Fans have been waiting for a new book in the planned seven-book series since the publication of a fifth, “A Dance With Dragons,” in 2011.
    But take heart. A new book is coming from Martin this year.
    The author said “Fire & Blood,” a tie-in book that he called a “monumental history of the Targaryen kings of Westeros,” is set for release, with illustrations throughout.
    “Oh, and there are dragons too,” he wrote. “Lots of dragons.”
    “Fire & Blood” is scheduled to be released in hardback on November 20.

    Read more: https://www.cnn.com/2018/04/26/entertainment/winds-winter-book-release/index.html

    The post No new ‘Game of Thrones’ book this year appeared first on Viral TV News.



    from WordPress http://www.viraltvnews.com/game_of_thrones/no-new-game-of-thrones-book-this-year/

We have already seen Ariana Grande use Labo during a U.S talk show and now IGN has filmed that Game of Thrones composer playing with Nintendo’s latest innovative product.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Finally got around to reading Game of Thrones. The first thing that struck me, aside from the initial themes of class conflict...
body:
Finally got around to reading Game of Thrones.

The first thing that struck me, aside from the initial themes of class conflict and myth vs reality, was the description of The Others.

Like, in the show, they feel very primal, like a snowy Neanderthal or a hairless Yeti. The name “The White Walkers” feels more suited to this image of them.

Meanwhile, the description of The Others in the prologue of the first book really pushes them as Ice-Fae: rather than their skin maybe being camouflage-esque and their weapons icicles, they actually feel like they’re magically invisible and their weapons are magical in nature. To a degree that makes me wonder how the showrunners came to their image of the White Walkers in the first place.

Maybe it’s Zeitgeist? I dunno? Again, the White Walkers feel primal and savage in the show, the only exception being the Night King, who actually does feel like an Ice-Fae (I’m not sure how much in this regard is his outfit, which feels more intelligent than the standard White Walker loincloth, and how much is his face, which is more angularly elfin, and his eyes, which feel very malevolently intelligent and contemplative). Or maybe some of the flavor of their mindless, undead armies bled into the rank-and-file White Walkers.

But it does feel fitting to have a name change from book to show, since the two have very different aesthetics (aside from the probability that the showrunners didn’t think the name “The Others” would be a very clear and unconfusing name for them, which, in a visual medium, I can understand. But maybe you could call them the Valyrian name for “Other”? Eh, it’s fine.) The name “White Walkers” does seem to evoke Ice-Neanderthals more, while The Others evokes the Fae.

The first thing that struck me, aside from the initial themes of class conflict and myth vs reality, was the description of The Others.

Like, in the show, they feel very primal, like a snowy Neanderthal or a hairless Yeti. The name “The White Walkers” feels more suited to this image of them.
